channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the NFL just put AI on its roster
item.description: Just in time for the season’s kick off, the National Football League (NFL) is tapping into artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze game and performanc...

item.title: Yes, Elon Musk Really Is Tweeting About Flying Cybertrucks
item.description: We probably shouldn’t take him too literally. But several companies are serious about developing next-gen electric aircraft.

item.title: Google’s Pixel 10 Phones Raise the Ante on Artificial Intelligence
item.description: A new lineup of Google’s Pixel smartphones is here and they come with a big dose of AI.

item.title: Sony will pass on tariff costs to U.S. consumers by hiking PlayStation 5 prices
item.description: The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.

item.title: How This Productivity App Helps You Focus—and Actually Enjoy Working
item.description: The Focus Friend app from entrepreneur Hank Green is all about an adorable bean that needs to get its knitting done.

item.title: Gavin Newsom’s Trump trolling is working. Here’s how we know

item.title: Spotify just turned your phone into a DJ booth
item.description: Impressing everyone when you’re handed the aux in the car to play DJ just got easier. Spotify now offers the option to listen to playlists with seamle...

item.title: Forget Flying Cars—Here’s a Winged Ferry
item.description: With investors like Peter Thiel and Mark Cuban, this company is trying to make boats that travel as fast as planes.

item.title: The Nastiest Fight in Fintech Just Got Nastier
item.description: Fintech unicorn Deel scores a legal victory, but its messy battle with rival Rippling heats up, with new barbs over accusations of corporate espionage...

item.title: Tesla shareholder group urges probe, ‘appropriate remedial action’ from Nasdaq over Elon Musk’s $29 billion pay package
item.description: The group’s letter argues that Tesla shareholders likely “did not believe they were voting on an equity plan that would cover compensation to Mr. Musk...

item.title: Meta wants to speed its race to ‘superintelligence’ — but investors will still want their billions in ad revenue
item.description: Even as Meta reorganizes once more to chase AI ‘superintelligence,’ the company’s core business still lives and dies by advertising revenue

item.title: Hank Green’s passion project to help you stop scrolling is dominating the App Store

item.title: A new FDA-approved device could change how Americans lose weight
item.description: Small wearable patches that continuously scan your blood and zap numbers to your smartphone are about to be everywhere . Once the sole domain of peopl...

item.title: Target’s incoming CEO started as a summer intern 20 years ago—he tells Gen Zers to embrace feedback if they want to climb the ladder like he did
item.description: What started as a summer placement in Target’s finance department two decades ago has turned into the top job for Michael Fiddelke. His advice for Gen...

item.title: Fed minutes reveal concern over ‘the effects of higher tariffs’ as central bank left rates unchanged
item.description: Most Federal Reserve officials said last month that the threat of higher inflation was a greater concern than the potential for job losses.
